name: Tortle
description: Tortles are reptilian-looking humanoids with large shells on their backs that they can withdraw into for protection.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Claws
traits.description: Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.description: You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour.

traits.name: Natural Armor
traits.description: Due to your shell and the shape of your body, you are ill-suited to wearing armor. Your shell provides ample protection, however; it gives you a base AC of 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn’t affect this number). You gain no benefit from wearing armor, but if you are using a shield, you can apply the shield’s bonus as normal.

traits.name: Shell Defense
traits.description: You can withdraw into your shell as an action. Until you emerge, you gain a +4 bonus to AC, and you have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in your shell, you are prone, your speed is 0, you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, you can’t take reactions, and the only action you can take is a bonus action to emerge from your shell.

traits.name: Survival Instinct
traits.description: You gain proficiency in the Survival skill.
